meanings.definition: Novelizers (noun): Those who write or create novels.
meanings.sent1: Many novelizers spend hours crafting intricate plots and developing characters.
meanings.sent2: The novelizers gathered at the book fair to discuss their latest works.
meanings.sent3: The group of novelizers decided to have a writing contest to see who could create the most captivating story.
meanings.sent4: She was a novelizer, weaving tales of adventure and romance with her words.
meanings.sent5: The novelizers' imaginations knew no bounds as they brought their stories to life on paper.

meanings.definition: Novelizers (verb): To adapt or transform a story into a novel.
meanings.sent1: Authors often novelize popular movies to reach a wider audience.
meanings.sent2: She novelized the classic fairy tale into a modern-day novel.
meanings.sent3: The students were challenged to novelize their favorite childhood stories for a school project.
meanings.sent4: He novelized his own experiences into a best-selling novel that captivated readers worldwide.
meanings.sent5: The author's ability to novelize historical events made the past come alive in her books.
